FuncDef:
The nat alarm session-number disable command disables the trap and log functions for the number of NAT sessions.
The undo nat alarm session-number disable command restores the default configuration.
By default, the trap and log functions for the number of NAT sessions are enabled.
CLIs: undo nat alarm session-number log disable
undo nat alarm session-number trap disable

ParaDef.Info:
Enables or disables the alarm function for the number of NAT sessions.
-

Enables or disables the log function for the number of NAT sessions.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To disable the trap or log function for the number of NAT sessions, run the nat alarm session-number disable command. If the number of NAT sessions on a specific service board reaches the alarm threshold, the service board can record a log and send a trap to the NMS. After the number of NAT sessions falls to 87.5% of the upper limit, the service can also record a log and send a clear trap to the NMS.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
